Demos!

1: Local, Typical Data Source

This example demonstrates using a local, fairly standard data source for tagimacating.

Configuration

Here's what the code looks like.

  • HTML
  • JS

        
<div tagimacator tagimacator-save-to="statesSave" tagimacator-filter-by="name" tagimacator-data="states"><div>
        
      
        
$scope.statesSave = [];

$scope.states = [
  { name: 'ALABAMA', abbreviation: 'AL'},
  { name: 'ALASKA', abbreviation: 'AK'},
  { name: 'AMERICAN SAMOA', abbreviation: 'AS'},

2: Remote, Large Data source

This examples demonstrates tagimacating with a lot of records, 5000 to be exact. It doesn't block page load by lazy loading data.

You'll also notice that query the result set is non blocking. This is accomplished by keystroke debouncing.


Here are some requirements/mentions for this method:

  • "tagimacator-data" must be a function that returns a thenable promise.
  • "tagimacator-filter-by" determines what property on an object will be shown and how the data will be filtered by when querying.
  • "tagimacator-save-by" determines what property will be used when saving tagged results to a mode. The distinction is present so duplicate tags don't get added.

Configuration

Here's what the code looks like

  • HTML
  • JS
  • DATA

        
<div tagimacator tagimacator-save-to="usersSave" tagimacator-save-by="_id" tagimacator-filter-by="name" tagimacator-data="getUsers"><div>
        
      
        
$scope.usersSave = [];
  
$scope.getUsers = function() {
  var def = $q.defer();

  $http({method:'GET', url:'http://myserver.com/users'}).success(function(users) {
    def.resolve(users);
  });

  return def.promise;
};
        
      
        
// Data example
// Filtering by name,
// Saving by _id
{
  age: 42,
  name: "Hank",
  _id: "5362f9d895f21a8c0e3d35cf"
}

Example:
